Instruction: In a large glass or ceramic bowl, mix lime juice, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, olive oil, garlic, and cumin. Add skirt steak, onion, and red bell peppers, tossing to coat evenly. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate to marinate for 30 minutes to 2 hours.

Preheat a grill over high heat. Cook skirt steak on the grill for about 4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or until desired doneness is reached. Remove from the grill and let rest for a few minutes before slicing against the grain.
Add 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil to the same skillet and heat over high heat. Cook and stir the onion and red bell pepper in the hot oil until softened, about 3 to 4 minutes.
Serve steak, onions, and peppers wrapped in warm tortillas with your choice of toppings.
You can substitute any color of bell peppers for the red bell peppers, if preferred.
You can substitute flank steak, carne asada, or chicken for the skirt steak, if preferred.
The nutritional information for this recipe accounts for the entire quantity of the marinade ingredients. The actual amount of marinade used may differ.
